titleStmt.title: Mock-beggers hall, with his scituation in the spacious country, called, Any where. To the tune of It is not your northern nanny; or Sweet is the lass that loves me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Harper, at the Bible and Harp in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: An edition of: "The map of Mock-beggar hall", originally published ca. 1635.
Verse: "In ancient times when as plain dealing".
In two parts, printed side by side.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
